qas.question: Max Weinreich is a linguist of what language?
What does "A shprakh iz a dialekt mit an armey un flot" mean in English?

answers.text: A language is a dialect with an army and navy

qas.question: When did Max Weinrich write "A shprakh iz a dialekt mit an armey un flot"?
In what did the army-navy publish the phrase  "A language is a dialect with an army and navy"?

plausible_answers.text: significance of the political factors in any attempt at answering the question "what is a language?

qas.question: What is illustrated by the frequency by Max Weinreich published his expression?
Which language is YIVO Bleter a linguist of?
Max Weinreich is what in relation to the YIVO Bleter language?

context: The <a0_0><b5_0>Yiddish<b5_0/><a0_0/> <b6_0>linguist<b6_0/> Max Weinreich published the expression, A shprakh iz a dialekt mit an armey un flot ("אַ שפּראַך איז אַ דיאַלעקט מיט אַן אַרמײ און פֿלאָט"‎: "<a1_0>A language is a dialect with an army and navy<a1_0/>") in <b3_0>YIVO Bleter<b3_0/> 25.1, <a2_0>1945<a2_0/>, p. 13. The <b4_0>significance of the political factors in any attempt at answering the question "what is a language?<b4_0/>" is great enough to cast doubt on whether any strictly linguistic definition, without a socio-cultural approach, is possible. This is illustrated by the frequency with which the army-navy aphorism is cited.
